content.title: Financial Assistance To Fishermen For Purchase of Fisheries Requisites (Gill Net/ River Gill Net with Accessories)
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance To Fishermen For Purchase of Fisheries Requisites (Gill Net/ River Gill Net with Accessories)' is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, a 50% subsidy is provided to the fishermen of Goa for the purchase of fisheries requisites (gill nets with accessories).
benefits: For General Category: 50% subsidy limited to ₹ 30,000/-
For SC/ST Category: 50% subsidy limited to ₹ 40,000/-
eligibility: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman by birth or profession.
The applicant should be a resident of Goa.
The applicant should or any of his households should not be defaulters with the Directorate of Fisheries.
The applicant should possess their own registered fishing canoe.
The original VAT bill may be submitted by the applicant from the authorized dealer to claim the subsidy.
The applicant shall not sell, lease, or transfer the Gill Net for five years from the date of purchase of the first Gill Net.
The fishing net shall be duly registered with the Directorate of Fisheries.
content.application_process: Offline. Step 1: The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521, or to the official posted at BDO Office/ Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.
documents_required: Certificate of Vessel Registration, issued by the Directorate of Fisheries, Government of Goa, under the Merchant Shipping Act 1958.
Original GST Bill from the Authorized Dealer towards the Construction of the Wooden / FRP Craft.
Inspection Report along with photographs of Fishing Canoe, Net, and its Accessories by Fisheries Superintendent/ Fisheries Officer.

faqs.question: Can the applicant claim the subsidy without submitting the original VAT bill?
faqs.answer: No, the original VAT bill must be submitted by the applicant from the authorized dealer to claim the subsidy.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy limit for SC/ST Category under the mentioned scheme?
faqs.answer: For SC/ST Category, the subsidy is 50%, limited to ₹40,000.

faqs.question: Is there a specific contact point for registering dissatisfaction or complaints about the scheme's services?
faqs.answer: Register complaints with the Departments Grievance Redressal Officer or through the link dir-fish.goa@nic.in.

faqs.question: What is the duration for which the applicant cannot sell, lease, or transfer the Gill Net after purchase?
faqs.answer: The fishing net cannot be sold, leased, or transferred for five years from the date of its purchase.

faqs.question: Can an applicant submit the application form and documents through an online platform?
faqs.answer: No, the application form and documents must be submitted physically to the Directorate of Fisheries or specified sub-offices.

faqs.question: Are there specific income criteria for eligibility, and what are they?
faqs.answer: There is no income criteria for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee or cost associated with applying for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The entire application process is entirely free of cost. There are no application fees.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory to Have a Bank Account for This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, possession of a valid bank account is a mandatory requirement for participation in this scheme.
